intro: Indigofera colutea, commonly known as wild indigo, is a flowering plant native to Africa, Asia, and Australia. It is a shrub or small tree that typically grows to a height of 1–3 meters. The plant produces small, pea-like flowers that range in color from white to purple, which bloom in clusters. Its leaves are trifoliate, consisting of three oval-shaped leaflets, and it has a fibrous root system. Indigofera colutea is often used in traditional medicine and as a source of dye due to its rich chemical composition.
